questions.question: The dentist recommended an …………………… surgeon.
questions.description: Oral means having to do with the mouth or speech.

questions.question: Hearing aids help a person to overcome some ……………………….. deficiencies.
questions.description: Oral means having to do with the mouth or speech. Aural means having to do with the ears or the sense of hearing.

questions.question: The city council passed an ………………………………… against jaywalking.
questions.description: An ordinance is a municipal law.

questions.question: The ………………………….. is stored in the armory.
His …………………………. appearance was calm.
questions.description: Outward is always correct as an adjective and an adverb. Outwards is correct only as an adverb.

questions.question: The ship headed ……………………. to deeper water.
questions.description: Outward is always correct as an adjective and an adverb. Outwards is correct only as an adverb.

questions.question: She bought two ……………………. of shoes.
questions.description: The singular form pair refers to only one pair of something.

questions.question: ................................... fire, don’t panic.
questions.description: We use in case of before a noun if is used before a clause.

questions.question: Father aged a lot this …………………………… year.
questions.description: Past refers to time gone by.

questions.question: The car …………………………… the truck at 70 miles an hour.
questions.description: Passed is the simple past of pass.

questions.question: A ………………………… problem is depressing him.
questions.description: Personal means belonging to a particular person.

questions.question: The company transferred some of its key …………………….. to Europe.
questions.description: Personnel means people employed on a job.
